Description: Copper alloy finger-ring with incised lines on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

This finger-ring is of a Roman type, with a close parallel in gold from Pompeii (Breglia 1941, 85, no. 825, pl. XXXVII.7) and in copper alloy in Britain (British Museum, 1982,0602.130). Breglia, L. 1941, Catalogo delle oreficerie del Museo nazionale di Napoli, Naples.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (QA.08)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
